name: Finance
description: Manage our budget, secure funding through grants and sponsorships, and ensure financial sustainability.
responsibilities: Budget planning and financial reporting
Grant writing and sponsorship outreach
Track expenses and revenue

teams.name: Budget Management Team
teams.description: Oversee chapter finances and maintain fiscal responsibility
responsibilities: Create and manage the chapter budget, tracking all income and expenses
Monitor spending across all departments and ensure alignment with budget
Prepare monthly financial reports for leadership team

teams.name: Fundraising & Grants Team
teams.description: Secure external funding and build donor relationships
responsibilities: Research and apply for grants from foundations and corporate sponsors
Build relationships with local businesses for donations and partnerships
Organize fundraising campaigns and donor appreciation events

learnMoreContent.skillsYoullGain: Financial analysis, grant writing, budget management, Excel/Google Sheets proficiency, professional communication, fundraising strategy, and nonprofit finance operations.
learnMoreContent.idealFor: Students interested in business, accounting, nonprofit management, or anyone looking to develop strong analytical and organizational skills.

name: Marketing
description: Spread the word about our mission through community outreach, social media, design graphics, create content, and organize awareness campaigns.
responsibilities: Social media content creation and management
Graphic design and visual communications
Event promotion and external relations

teams.name: Social Media Team
teams.description: Manage our online presence and community engagement
responsibilities: Create engaging content for Instagram, Facebook, and other platforms
Schedule posts and monitor engagement metrics
Respond to messages and build community connections

teams.name: Design Team
teams.description: Create visual content and brand materials
responsibilities: Design graphics, flyers, and promotional materials using Canva or Adobe Creative Suite
Maintain brand consistency across all visual communications
Create templates and design assets for events and campaigns

teams.name: External Relations Team
teams.description: Build partnerships and manage public relations
responsibilities: Coordinate with local media and campus organizations for PR opportunities
Plan and execute marketing campaigns for events and fundraising initiatives
Develop partnerships with student organizations and community groups

learnMoreContent.skillsYoullGain: Social media marketing, graphic design, content creation, brand management, public relations, and digital communications. You'll learn industry-standard tools and build a portfolio of real work.
learnMoreContent.idealFor: Creative students interested in marketing, communications, journalism, or design. Perfect for anyone who loves storytelling and connecting with audiences.

name: Operations
description: Work hands-on with computers—diagnose issues, replace parts, install operating systems, and prepare devices for donation.
responsibilities: Computer refurbishment and repair
Device sourcing and donation coordination
Distribution to community members
Open to all—no application needed!

teams.name: Refurbishment Team
teams.description: Repair, upgrade, and prepare computers for distribution
responsibilities: Diagnose hardware and software issues in donated computers
Replace components, upgrade hardware, and perform repairs
Install operating systems and essential software on refurbished devices

teams.name: Distribution & Logistics Team
teams.description: Manage inventory and coordinate computer distributions
responsibilities: Track inventory of computers, parts, and supplies
Coordinate device distribution to community members in need
Organize pickup/delivery logistics for donations

learnMoreContent.skillsYoullGain: Hardware troubleshooting, software installation, inventory management, quality control, and technical documentation. You'll develop practical IT skills that are directly applicable to careers in technology support, systems administration, and computer repair.
learnMoreContent.idealFor: Hands-on learners, tech enthusiasts, and anyone wanting practical experience with computer hardware and software. No prior experience required—just curiosity and a willingness to learn! Perfect for students interested in IT, computer science, or anyone who wants to make a tangible impact in their community.

name: Membership
description: Foster chapter culture, organize events, manage member engagement, and ensure compliance with organizational policies.
responsibilities: Event planning and member engagement
Chapter development and training programs
Compliance and policy management
Open to all—no application needed!

teams.name: Events & Engagement Team
teams.description: Plan and execute social events and member engagement activities
responsibilities: Plan and execute social events, workshops, and team-building activities
Track member engagement and ensure active participation across teams
Create fun and inclusive experiences that strengthen chapter bonds

teams.name: Training & Development Team
teams.description: Develop onboarding programs and training resources
responsibilities: Develop training programs and onboarding materials for new members
Conduct orientation sessions and mentorship programs
Create resources and documentation for skill development

teams.name: Compliance & Policy Team
teams.description: Ensure organizational compliance and policy adherence
responsibilities: Maintain chapter compliance with national policies and university regulations
Document and communicate policy updates to members
Coordinate with national organization and university administration

learnMoreContent.skillsYoullGain: Event management, community building, policy administration, leadership development, and organizational communication. You'll learn how to cultivate an inclusive chapter culture while ensuring operational excellence and regulatory compliance.
learnMoreContent.idealFor: People-oriented students, aspiring leaders, and anyone interested in organizational development and community engagement. Perfect for those who want to shape chapter culture, build meaningful connections, and ensure Binary Heart at IU remains a welcoming, effective, and compliant organization.
